title: Basic Geometry Practice Exam
description: Test your understanding of basic geometry including angles, shapes, perimeter, and area.

questions.question: An angle that measures exactly 90° is called a:
questions.explanation: A right angle measures exactly 90°, like the corner of a square or rectangle.

questions.question: A square has 4 equal sides and 4 right angles.
questions.explanation: This is the definition of a square. All four sides are the same length, and all four angles are 90° (right angles).

questions.question: A rectangle has a length of 10 cm and a width of 6 cm. What is the perimeter? (Enter just the number)
What is the area of a square with sides that are 5 inches long?
questions.explanation: Using the formula $A = s^2$: $A = 5 \times 5 = 25$ square inches.

questions.question: A rectangular room is 12 feet long and 9 feet wide. What is the area? (Enter just the number)
questions.explanation: Using the formula $A = l \times w$: $A = 12 \times 9 = 108$ square feet.

questions.question: What type of angle is greater than 90° but less than 180°?
questions.explanation: An obtuse angle is greater than 90° but less than 180°. It's wider than a right angle but not a straight line.

questions.question: A square has a perimeter of 24 meters. What is the length of one side?
questions.explanation: Using $P = 4s$, we have $24 = 4s$. Dividing both sides by 4: $s = 6$ meters.

questions.question: Sarah wants to put a border around a rectangular poster that is 8 inches long and 6 inches wide. How many inches of border does she need? (Enter just the number)
questions.explanation: The border goes around the perimeter. $P = 2(8) + 2(6) = 16 + 12 = 28$ inches of border needed.
